title: Emilia Clarke swaps Game of Thrones' dragons for Chekhov's The Seagull
description: Actress Emilia Clarke explains why she is petrified ahead of her West End stage debut.

title: As audiences return to Glastonbury and other festivals, will they cope?
description: After two years of cancellations, music fans could experience a mixture of relief and anxiety.

title: What happened when Israel sent its refugees to Rwanda
description: As the UK presses on with its asylum deal, refugees sent from Israel to Rwanda describe their experiences.

title: Ukraine war: High school students pose in prom dresses among ruins
description: Photographer Stanislav Senyk organised a photo shoot of students in the bombed city of Chernihiv.

title: How Aussie farmers are hoping to win over tequila fans
description: Two Australia farmers are aiming rival Mexican tequila and mezcal with a similar delicious spirit.

title: Johnson hints that new coal mine for Cumbria will get go-ahead
description: The government faces a huge decision over what to do in Cumbria, amid employment and climate concerns.

title: Afghanistan earthquake: 'Every street you go you hear mourning'
description: Witnesses describe desperate scenes after a powerful earthquake hits Afghanistan.

title: Fears for US woman's life as abortion denied in Malta
description: Andrea's pregnancy is no longer viable but doctors cannot intervene unless she goes into labour or develops sepsis.

title: The tiny mites that have sex on our faces have a problem
description: The 0.3mm long organisms live deep in the pores of our faces but may be about to go extinct.

title: UK inflation hits highest for 40 years as food drives prices up
description: Food price rises, particularly for bread, cereal and meat, drives inflation to its highest rate since 1982.

title: Afghan earthquake: 1,000 people killed and 1,500 wounded, official says
description: The country's deadliest quake in two decades struck overnight as many people slept in their beds.

title: Sadio Mane: Bayern Munich sign Senegal forward from Liverpool in £35m deal
description: Sadio Mane completes a £35m move from Liverpool to Bayern Munich on a three-year contract.

title: Asda says some shoppers asking cashiers to stop at £30
description: Rising food prices are sparking a "massive change in behaviour", the supermarket's chairman tells the BBC.

title: Half Russian separatist force dead or wounded - UK
description: UK military intelligence believes the Donetsk militia in occupied Ukraine has lost 55% of its force.

title: Rail strike: Talks to end dispute resume as travellers face more delays
description: The RMT are meeting rail bosses to try to resolve the dispute over jobs, pay and conditions.

title: Glastonbury Festival welcomes back crowds as fans deal with travel disruption
description: Worthy Farm will welcome more than 200,000 festival-goers, but some have had to change their plans.

title: Rotherham abuse scandal: Operation Linden report 'lets victims down'
description: A long-awaited report into police failings is published but is criticised for a lack of new findings.

title: Ukraine war: 'My kids cried every night asking if we're going to die'
description: Kateryna and her two sons are among 60 families in a camp set up for Ukrainian refugees fleeing war.

title: Chancellor Rishi Sunak defends likely pensions rise
description: There's criticism of the move as ministers warn workers not to expect pay rises to match increasing costs.

title: Bulldozer crushes 100 seized vehicles in New York
description: It is illegal to ride dirt bikes and ATVs (all-terrain vehicles) on the US city's streets.

title: The Open: Players who have joined LIV Golf series permitted to play at St Andrews
description: Players who have joined the Saudi Arabian-backed LIV Golf series will be allowed to play at The Open at St Andrews next month.

title: Kate Bush says the 'world has gone mad' after going back to number one
description: The singer gives a rare interview after going to number one thanks to the hit show Stranger Things.

title: Is Dominic Raab's quest to reform human rights law almost over?
description: The deputy PM says a British Bill of Rights will keep people safer, but it faces angry opposition.

title: First openly gay judge to lead LGBT veterans probe
description: Campaigners hope the outcome of review into the pre-2000 ban will entitle them to compensation.

title: Rail strike: Bristol staff say replacing them is dangerous
description: The Government's plan to replace railway staff during the strikes is dangerous, say Bristol RMT members.

title: Upskirt photos shared in Facebook groups, BBC finds
description: Meta says it has removed accounts and groups showing upskirting, after a BBC investigation.

title: Swastika: Victoria bans display of Nazi symbol in Australian first
description: Victoria is the first state to outlaw the symbol, amid a rise in anti-Semitic incidents.

title: Newspaper headlines: Strike 'stalemate' and bill 'fatally weakens human rights'
description: The fallout from the biggest rail strikes in decades continues to lead nearly all the front pages.
